channel.title: reducing number of clicks to download Whonix / Thank You page
channel.description:
Currently a new user might...
go to whonix.org
click 1: dowload click 2: Windows click 3: download
Can this process be improved / number of clicks reduced?
click 1 seems unavoidable since Whonix is available for multiple operating systems. (Unless user scrolls down on whonix.org main page and clicks "Windows". [link fixed to Whonix Quick Start in git master already])
Could click 2 perhaps donwload Whonix Windows Installer and open a "Thank You" page?
That "Thank You" page would be actually short instructions on how to use it, similar to what https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Windows_Quick_Start is now but without big download button.
Tor Project nowadays has a Thank You page. When you go to https://www.torproject.org/download/ and click to download TBB...
* user gets redirected to https://www.torproject.org/thank-you/ * file download starts
That works only when JavaScript is enabled.
Looks like a "Thank You" page is only possible with JavaScript?
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14695216/how-can-i-display-a-thankyou-page-after-user-downloads-file
Possible to make a "Thank You" page without JavaScript?

Patrick:

Possible to make a “Thank You” page without JavaScript?

Looks doable.

If anyone is intersted, you can see the page source (in Tor Browser) “long way”:

Click the hamburger top right hand corner of Tor Browser → Web Developer→ Page Source.

Easy way: click Ctrl +U
